algorithms

Class NonNegativeMatrixFactorization

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.NonNegativeMatrixFactorization

  • public class NonNegativeMatrixFactorization
extends java.lang.Object
    This class performs non-negative matrix factorization.

    Given a matrix X with non-negative entries, we find non-negative matrices W and H that minimize the objective function Distance(X, W x H)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NonNegativeMatrixFactorization(UpdateRule updateRuleW, UpdateRule updateRuleH, double tolerance, int maxIteration)
      Creates an instance of Non-Negative Matrix Factorization

    • Constructor Detail

      • NonNegativeMatrixFactorization

        public NonNegativeMatrixFactorization(@Nonnull
                                      UpdateRule updateRuleW,
                                      @Nonnull
                                      UpdateRule updateRuleH,
                                      double tolerance,
                                      int maxIteration)
        Creates an instance of Non-Negative Matrix Factorization
        Parameters:
        updateRuleW - instance of UpdateRule for matrix W
        updateRuleH - instance of UpdateRule for matrix H
        tolerance - tolerance for the fitting error
        maxIteration - maximum number of iterations to use

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(@Nonnull
                    org.jblas.DoubleMatrix data,
                    @Nonnull
                    org.jblas.DoubleMatrix w,
                    @Nonnull
                    org.jblas.DoubleMatrix h)
        Performs the non-negative matrix factorization with given initial components and coefficients. We use alternate coordinate descent method where we alternate between updating matrices W and H
        Parameters:
        data - matrix of shape [num_points, num_vectors], a collection of vectors in num_points-dimensional space
        w - matrix of shape [num_points, num_vectors], a collection of initial components
        h - matrix of shape [num_components, num_vectors], a collection of initial decomposition coefficients
